briefTitle: Safety And Efficacy of Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir/Voxilaprevir Fixed-Dose Combination for 12 Weeks in Adults Who Participated in a Prior Gilead-Sponsored HCV Treatment Study
officialTitle: An Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety And Efficacy of Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir/Voxilaprevir Fixed-Dose Combination for 12 Weeks in Subjects Who Participated in a Prior Gilead-Sponsored HCV Treatment Study
summary: The primary objectives of this study are to determine the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of treatment with sofosbuvir/velpatasvir/voxilaprevir (SOF/VEL/VOX) fixed-dose combination (FDC) for 12 weeks in participants with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection with or without cirrhosis, who did not achieve sustained viral response (SVR) after receiving prior treatment in a Gilead-sponsored HCV treatment study of direct-acting antiviral (DAA)-containing regimens.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) 12 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR12)
